Text.Value: Geraldus lived so he could warn you. Don't Harpers serve the greater good?
Don't thank me yet. How do I know you're not a doppelganger, too?
What's a Rashemaar?
Old Danthelon wouldn't have let you down here without Jaheira's say-so. I'll give you my report - it's up to you after that.
I'm sure it felt that way, Geraldus. The others were likely dragged back to Orin. Tortured. Sacrificed.
I will not. If I bare my teeth, it is probably because you have struck at a sore spot.
Right... equal to the High Harper. You can give her my report, then.
And they're not just working with the cult, High Harper - they're part of it. Bhaalists, I think.
No. Jaheira - High Harper - please. I'm still a Harper. I want to help.
Oh thank the gods. You're the first friendly face I've seen in days, old Danthelon included.
An old code, Harper - but yes, you got it right. Now I need your report.
Not when this mess is of my making. I sent the Harpers hunting after the cult without thinking what it would mean to be hunted in turn. Now they are compromised.
Wait, Jaheira. You're acting like this is his fault - it's yours.

EditorData.logicalname: Only Jaheira talking to the harper

Text.Value: This work isn't for everyone, boy, and there's no shame in that. Go home to your mother, and leave the task to us.
This talk of the Rashemaar. It sounds like you sent Harpers hunting something you shouldn't have.
You saw it. The cult fell on my friends, and took their faces. All because Jaheira sent us searching for him.
And some explaining to do, it seems.

EditorData.NodeContext: Tired sigh, resigned to tell the player everything.

Text.Value: Yes, High Harper.
A Harper code. Meant to be used for doppelgangers, impostors. Things like them.
But they were the ones hunting us. Things were quiet - until we started to ask about the Rashemaar.
They were tracking you instead, evidently. Doppelgangers.
I do not expect you to die for me. But to risk Entharl? Any citizen who might have wandered in?
First, Geraldus - you're the last Harper in the city I can rely on. Lay low, and rest while you can. I have matters to discuss with my friend here.
Who is this Rashemaar? What does Jaheira want with them?
And if not for you, I wouldn't even know it. I'm sorry, Geraldus. Harper.
The others... they're all dead, or scattered. Jaheira sent word of the victory over Ketheric, set us hunting after cultists in the city.
I most humbly beg your pardon?

EditorData.NodeContext: Translation: What the fuck did you just say?

Text.Value: They struck the same night. I woke to one of them strangling Chelvin, while smiling at me out of her face.
Nothing. Forget it.
Selne's Tears. It is said no false face can stand beneath their light.
And then what happened?
I'll come clean. I did not tell you all about what I hoped to learn here today - I will rectify that.
She said - it said - that I'd report back to you as normal. Lure you here, and... I had no choice.
I'm not a Harper. I was just passing by.
Did I - did I get it right?

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: Player and Jahiera are talking to harper

Text.Value: We had eyes on suspected cultists in the city, like you asked. We thought we were tracking them, but...
She's right, Geraldus. You did your part. Go live your life.
This mess is of my making. I sent the Harpers hunting after the cult without thinking what it would mean to be hunted in turn. Now they are compromised.
I... the High Harper didn't tell you? Perhaps... it's not my place.
I am. I'm here to help.
Just... tell her this. I can't continue the hunt. Whatever the cult has done with the Rashemaar - they do not want him found.
But first - Geraldus. Does your mother still own that farm in the Dalelands?
You speak of something you know nothing about. But then - why would you, when I have not told it?
And I owe you an apology, as well. I haven't told you everything I hoped to learn here today.
Just Jaheira to you, now. Go on - I have all the help I need.
*Rashemaar - a native of Rashemen, the far eastern land known for its wild inhabitants and the witches who rule them.*
No one can make that choice for him. Not even you, High Harper.
Sworn to Orin the Red, yes. We've... already had the pleasure. Go on.
...Exactly the kind a Harper would spout, I suppose. Fine. I have no right to make the choice for you.
Everything seemed fine, until... your latest orders. Until we started to search for the Rashemaar.
I'm... alive. That's more than the others can say.
No thanks necessary. Are you hurt?
Thank - thank you.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: Only player (not Jaheira) is talking to harper

Text.Value: Enough of the Harper dramatics. What do we do now?
You've scarcely signed up, boy, and there is a war coming. Why die a Harper, when you could still live as anything else?
You're... you're the one High Harper Jaheira sent?
There is always a choice - and a Harper must be able to make the hard ones. Perhaps this isn't the life for you after all, Geraldus.
She didn't send me anywhere. We're allies. Equals.
What was all that 'Selne's Tears' nonsense?
You volunteer wisdom where it is not wanted. All the more galling, then, that you are right.
Because... I'm not. I swear.
Death is death. To look for meaning in it is foolishness, boy. Childish, storybook nonsense.
Answering to Orin the Red, then. Go on.

EditorData.NodeContext: Quick, grim pause for thought on the idea of Orin having a horde of shapeshifters in her service. Brusquely back to the point, keeping Geraldus on topic.

Text.Value: I want to fight... for Chelvin. For all of them. So it means something.

Synopsis: Dialog with the real harper in Danthelon basement after saving him from a doppelganger ambush. He tells us how Jaheira's Harpers were infiltrated and killed, while he was forced to lure her into a trap. Jaheira will want to dismiss Geraldus for his own safety, but the player can intervene.
